args: Say, Leif? I was wondering if you'd be\nwilling to teach me Alberian chess.
Of course, Highness. But if I may ask,\nwhy the sudden interest?
I'd like to be able to consider battlefield\ntactics more carefully.
And I remember how you used to say chess\nwas good practice for that kind of thing.
If that is the situation, I am glad to help.\nPlease give me a little while to prepare.
...And so, those are the fundamental\ntactics used during the game's opening.\nHave you any questions so far?
Yeesh... Maybe you can give me\na moment to sort all of this out?\nMy brain hurts.
I mean, I think I get the basic rules,\nbut I'm finding it hard to convert that\nknowledge into tactics.

Do not get flustered, Highnessâ€”it is that
way for all students of the game at first.
Bear in mind, however, that the state of
the battle is ever in flux.
You must train your mind so you are able\nto react to such ever-changing conditions\nin the heat of the moment.
You know, this is starting to remind\nme of Chelle; she used to play chess\nall the time.
Yes, and she often bade me to serve as\nher opponent.
She, Prince Phares, and Prince Valyx were\nall skilled opponents, but Prince Leonidas\nwas a particularly cunning player...
I annihilate your woodland archers\nwith my stone trebuchet.
Then I shall use this chance to claim\nyour grassland warriors.
Heh. Have you turned a blind eye\nto my sellswords?
Ah, but if I let fear rule the day and move\nto take your sellswords, I will be unable\nto protect my sorcerer princess.
What you name cowardice is, in fact,\na sound stratagem.

As my sellswords protect the sorcerer
princess, so, too, does a true knight
protect their royal charge. Thus, no
chance at victory is ever missed.
Ah, you're countering my attack with the\nsorcerer princess you just protected.\nA shrewd moveâ€”if an insufficient one.
A knight may serve as a defender,\nbut the royal walks the path of\nconquest, whatever the situation.
A double check! This is quite the upset.
You have become quite skilled,\nYour Highness.
And you have become worse.\nI grow weary of our matches.
I will endeavor not to disappoint you\nin the future, Prince Leonidas.
After a performance like this, I worry about\nyour future on a real battlefield.
The world is much like a chessboard,\nmy dear Leif.
You accept an assignment, fulfill it, and then\nperish for the sake of your sovereign.
Indeed. In real life as in the game,\nmany are sacrificed so the monarchy\nmight remain alive and well.
We stake our lives on protecting the royal\nfamily from any who would do them ill.
Even if the ones who would do them ill\nare from the same royal line?
Look well upon our board. In the end,\nthere is but one sovereign left standing.
A royal family is not always a monolith;\ncountless tomes are filled with histories of\nfamilies who clashed amongst themselves.
If a future such as that awaited us,\nwhat would you protect?
Peace in Alberia, above all else.
Oh ho! An excellent answer! But let me\nput another question to you: What IS\nthis ï¼‚peaceï¼‚ you would seek to protect?
Stability for all who reside in Alberia,\nand the prosperity of her royal family.
Heh... Aaaaah ha ha ha! Oh, my dear Leif.\nI suppose you believe prosperity possible\neven for a house divided, then?
It is as you say: A split in the royal family\nwould be a grave threat to peace.
However, if such a split were to occur,\nI would stake my life on redressing it.\nThis I do for the sake of my homeland.
I see. So you believe the peace of the\nkingdom can be maintained so long\nas you are present?

It is not granted, for it is not necessary.
Such arrogance means only that you are
devoted fully to your idealsâ€”a realization
I find most welcome indeed.
But in that case, I have a final\nquestion for you.
Suppose I were to be the one standing\nin the way of the peace you espouse.\nWould you put me to the sword?
Were you to walk an errant path,\nYour Highness...
Yes. I would raise my sword against you\nfor the sake of peace in Alberia.
Ah! My apologies, Your Highness.\nIt seems I was woolgathering.
It's not like you to let your mind wander\nin the middle of a conversation.
I was overtaken for a moment\nwith a memory of the past.
You mentioned Leonidas just before you\nstopped talking. Does it have something\nto do with him?

It does. I had quite some confidence in my
own chess skills, but the last game we
played ended in my utter defeat.
And after that, we...
Your Highness, may I ask you a question?
What is the peace you fight to protect?
I fight so people everywhere\ncan live in happiness.
And does that include your siblings?
For no matter the kingdom, there can\nonly be one seated upon the throne.
Knowing that, do you think the kingdom of\nhappiness and peace you seek is possible?
I don't think it's possibleâ€”I KNOW it is.\nAnd I will see it done.
...Heh. I was afraid that was coming.\nTo be honest, I'm not exactly sure.
But a peace built on the sacrifices\nof others isn't what I'm looking for.
Still, I'm going to find some way to make\nit happen. I will make sure everyone is\nhappyâ€”and that includes my siblings.
You are a truly kind person, Your Highness.\nDown to the very core of your heart.
I know my older brothers have a different\nopinion on things, but I have no intention\nof yielding one inch on my own views.
So I don't think I act out of kindness at all.\nIt's more like...arrogance.
Such arrogance means only that you are\ndevoted fully to your ideals...
Just something that was said to me once.
Your arrogance, Highness, is wonderful,\nfor it shows the power of your spirit.
I would make a request of you, Highness.
If ever I should stand in the way of\nthe peace and happiness you seek...\nIf ever I travel an errant path...
You must see me punished for it.
I can't ever see you doing that, Leif.
Still... Well, I suppose anyone can\nmake a mistake.
So if that ever happens, I'll set\nyou straight.
Thank you, Your Highness.\nYou set my mind at ease.
With this, I, too, will be able to seek\nthe same peace you do.
Forgive me, just talking to myself.\nNow then! I believe we've a lecture\non chess to complete, yes?
